channel.title: Any practical benefit of having two ISPs?
channel.description: Hello. Is it worth to have two separate ISPs? One for real activities and the second one for Tor connections. Or having one ISP but two VM (one for Whonix and one for clearnet) is generally enough?

item.title: Any practical benefit of having two ISPs?
item.dc:creator: AnonymityDoesMatter
item.description:
HulaHoop:

both the billing trail

I don’t pay for anything using Tor because I’m strongly sure that payments without mining pure cryptocurrency cannot be anonymous.

I just think that mixing Tor and clearnet traffic is a bad idea that’s why I think it is better to use two ISPs, one for Tor and one for clearnet.

Read full topic
item.source: Any practical benefit of having two ISPs?

item.title: Any practical benefit of having two ISPs?
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
AnonymityDoesMatter:

Hello. Is it worth to have two separate ISPs? One for real activities and the second one for Tor connections. Or having one ISP but two VM (one for Whonix and one for clearnet) is generally enough?

No not really because both the billing trail and MAC addresses will be enough to link back to you. Unless you take additional steps like burner sims in cash combined with disposable Wifi USBs also bought in cash.

Read full topic
item.source: Any practical benefit of having two ISPs?

item.title: Any practical benefit of having two ISPs?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
No additional comment available.

AnonymityDoesMatter:

I’ve read it but I didn’t find any information what type of ISP is safer, mobile or wired/wi-fi ? Also, is it really worth to use mobile ISP for real activities and wired for Whonix or not?

General Tor question. Suggested rewrite:

What type of ISP is safer, mobile or wired/wi-fi?
Is it worth to use mobile ISP for real activities and wired for Tor or not?

Suggest to research this as per:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle

Read full topic
